Sentencas: Multiphysics models are important tools for the design and optimization of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Parametric study of kW-class solid oxide fuel cell stacks fueled by hydrogen and methane with fully multiphysical coupling model

Sentencas: The computational efficiency of a sophisticated multiphysics model is improved by a factor of 4 by symmetry utilization and grid optimization, allowing its routine use for the analysis and diagnosis of industrial-sized SOFC stacks.
Titulo: Parametric study of kW-class solid oxide fuel cell stacks fueled by hydrogen and methane with fully multiphysical coupling model

Sentencas: The predictive power of the model is tested by the experimental data.
Titulo: Parametric study of kW-class solid oxide fuel cell stacks fueled by hydrogen and methane with fully multiphysical coupling model

Sentencas: Parametric numerical studies, together with indepth theoretical analyses, on the performance characteristics of kW-class stacks fueled by H-2 and CH4 are carried out with this accurate model.
Titulo: Parametric study of kW-class solid oxide fuel cell stacks fueled by hydrogen and methane with fully multiphysical coupling model

Sentencas: It is concluded: (1) CH4 is advantageous for providing lower maximum temperature and temperature gradient, and higher energy efficiency.
Titulo: Parametric study of kW-class solid oxide fuel cell stacks fueled by hydrogen and methane with fully multiphysical coupling model

Sentencas: (2) H-2 is advantageous for generating more electricity and being more resistant to fuel starvation.
Titulo: Parametric study of kW-class solid oxide fuel cell stacks fueled by hydrogen and methane with fully multiphysical coupling model

Sentencas: (3) Insufficient air supply can cause high thermal gradient.
Titulo: Parametric study of kW-class solid oxide fuel cell stacks fueled by hydrogen and methane with fully multiphysical coupling model

Sentencas: (4) Fuel uniformity is critically dependent on the stack design and affects all aspects of stack performance.
Titulo: Parametric study of kW-class solid oxide fuel cell stacks fueled by hydrogen and methane with fully multiphysical coupling model
